text: The Southern Railway (SR) gave the designation 2Nol to the electric multiple units built during the 1930s from old London and South Western Railway carriage bodies on new underframes. None of these units survived long enough in British Rail ownership to be allocated a TOPS class.Weddell, G.R. (1992). L.S.W.R. Carriages, volume one: 1838-1900. Didcot: Wild Swan. pp. 183, 185, 187, 203, 233â€“8. ISBN 1-874103-08-9. ==References== SR 2Nol
title: SR Class 2Nol
